headline: Electronic Arts Q1, Steve Madden Q2 miss, Harley-Davidson deal
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal joins Market Domination with Josh Lipton to discuss some of the afternoon's trending tickers and stories. Electronic Arts (EA) beat net booking estimates in its better-than-expected first quarter results. Steve Madden (SHOO) missed estimates in its second quarter results and declined to provide full-year guidance. Harley-Davidson (HOG) missed second quarter expectations, but the stock is trading higher after the company announced a partnership with KKR (KKR) and Pimco (PDI) to create $1.25 billion in discretionary cash. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Why Is Electronic Arts (EA) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
summary: Shares of video game publisher Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) jumped 5.8% in the morning session after the company reported strong first-quarter financial results that surpassed expectations, overshadowing a weaker outlook for the upcoming quarter.

content.title: Why Is Electronic Arts (EA) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
content.summary: Shares of video game publisher Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) jumped 5.8% in the morning session after the company reported strong first-quarter financial results that surpassed expectations, overshadowing a weaker outlook for the upcoming quarter.
